programme.desc: The life and career of the American star, who won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance as Idi Amin in The Last King of Scotland

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: The actor explores hidden government facilities and their secret operations, from a Soviet poison lab to a nuclear site under Greenlands ice and a US doomsday bunker inside a mountain

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Egypts Cosmic Code
programme.desc: The presenter dives deeper into Egypts mysteries, exploring the Great Sphinx and the underground Serapeum with its precision-cut granite sarcophagi, questioning their purpose and links to the pyramid enigma. Travelling south, he visits the intricately designed Dendera Temple, where hieroglyphs and imagery hint at possible extraterrestrial connections. He concludes at the sprawling Karnak temple complex, marvelling at its monumental engineering, sphinx-lined avenues, and Hatshepsuts towering obelisk - wondering whether its simply a monument or a channel for cosmic energy

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A UFO is spotted over one of the worlds holiest sites, while some believe a mysterious floating spaceman in a famous photograph could be an elaborate, decades-long hoax. Plus, the apparent superhumans who can stop cars barehanded

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: The London Serpent and Moon UFOs
programme.desc: An examination of several seemingly impossible things caught on film. This episode features a serpentine monster said to be lurking under the water of the River Thames. Plus, UFOs spotted crossing the moon and how some people seem able to defy the fear of heights

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: In 1943, Germany fell at Stalingrad, its first major defeat. In the Pacific, Japan lost momentum after the US won at Guadalcanal

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: In 1944, D-Day pierced the Atlantic Wall, as Operation Bagration crushed the Wehrmacht in the East. Plus, the fall of the Third Reich began

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: Compilation of the most compelling mysteries featured on the Ancient Aliens series, here focusing on evidence of ancient flying machines. The Saqqara Bird, an artifact from ancient Egypt on display at the Cairo Museum, strikingly resembles modern aircraft. Ancient Sanskrit texts describe vimanas - intricate flying machines of the gods - in remarkable detail, while early biblical accounts contain similar technical references to the chariots of the gods

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Reported accounts of alien encounters, hearing from people who believe that beings from other worlds have the means to control humanity

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on expeditions through some of Britains most historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from the nations past. He begins with a 40-mile walk along the Derwent Valley in the Peak District, where the worlds industrial revolution was born. En route he visits the sleepy village of Cromford to find out about the work of entrepreneur Richard Arkwright, and stops off at a 900-year-old stately home that has been used as the location for three Jane Eyre films. Brian Blessed also introduces Tony to the joys - and the significance - of the Cromford canal, before this leg of his journey ends in Derby

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Arthurs Stone and a Georgian Mine
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition she heads to a spectacular monument that is older than Stonehenge, a 200-year-old mine trapped in time, and a lost medieval friary

programme.title: The Nostradamus Effect
programme.desc: Examining the plausibility of apocalyptic prophecies throughout history. This edition focuses on Isaac Newtons obsession with alchemy and biblical prophecies

programme.title: The Nostradamus Effect
programme.desc: In 1947, ancient scrolls were discovered in desert caves near the Dead Sea. One of them spells out - in chilling detail - a future apocalyptic war. This documentary considers the plausibility of such prophecies

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: Andy McGrath returns to Cornwall, searching for legends. He meets a real-life mermaid, stalks a local churchyard for owl men and faeries, and stops off at a haunted smugglers inn to learn about its ghostly residents

programme.title: Rust Valley Restorers
programme.desc: As the clock ticks towards his auction, Mike races to restore as many cars as he can. At Wildman, Avery struggles to finish the Manta in time for it to be painted, and Connor ties the knot in Rust Valleys biggest event of the year

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: The actor investigates daring government operations, revealing uncensored evidence and the lengths to which elite operatives have gone to complete missions. Examples include the record-shattering depths submarine divers have plunged to tap a secret Soviet communication line to the Special Ops team of suicidal soldiers sent to hand-deploy A-bombs in enemy territory

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Egypts Cosmic Code
programme.desc: The presenter sets out to uncover the mysteries of King Tutankhamun. Along the way, he encounters the enigmatic Alien King Akhenaten and his wife, Nefertiti. Sailing down the Nile, he investigates how the Ancient Egyptians transported enormous stone blocks for their architectural marvels, including the 700-ton Colossi of Memnon. His quest then leads him into the Valley of the Kings, where he discovers the resting places of Akhenaten and King Tuts successor, Horemheb - before finally coming face to face with the mummy of the Boy King himself

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: Ancient Alien Carvings and Bigfoot Shrooms
programme.desc: An examination of several seemingly impossible things caught on film. A man believes he recorded Bigfoot on video while foraging for mushrooms. Plus, how rock paintings discovered in India might be proof of an ancient visitation and the capture of a fleet of UFOs on film crossing in front of the sun

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: The Nightcrawler and the Beast in the Tree
programme.desc: The team looks into a new sighting of Sasquatch in the trees of California. Plus, a man claims to have captured footage of the infamous Fresno Nightcrawlers in his back yard and mysterious streaks are witnessed in the night sky in Australia

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: The story of Britains first female agents sent to the front line during the Second World War and spymistress Vera Atkins, who led them. In the tumult of the conflict, French Resistance fighters sought aid from Britains Special Operations Executive (SOE) against Nazi occupation. Led by Romanian-born Atkins, SOE enlisted female agents including Odette Sansom and Noor Inayat Khan to take the fight to the Germans. As tensions soared, Noor navigated occupied France, while Atkins grappled with tough decisions. She and her team raced against time to safeguard SOEs mission, braving sacrifices for victory

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: The story of Britains first female agents sent to the front line during the Second World War and spymistress Vera Atkins, who led them. In the face of danger, Vera ramped up her recruitment of female agents. Chaos ensued as the Prosper circuit in Paris neared collapse. Meanwhile, Noor, deep in Parisian resistance, struggled to maintain cover. Vera enlisted agents like Violette Szabo and Yvonne Baseden, but uncertainty shrouds their upcoming missions

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, William Henry and Jason Martell through the archives of Ancient Aliens to uncover in-depth descriptions and portrayals of entities from Egyptian, Sumerian, Chinese, Mesoamerican and Native American traditions. Ancient Astronaut theorists propose that descriptions of sky gods and star beings might reflect real encounters with extraterrestrial visitors in the remote past

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Theorists investigate whether extraterrestrials might have inspired Adolf Hitler to embark on a crazed quest for global domination, and try to track down the Fuhrers alien secret

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the areas rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarchs reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Headless Romans and Anglo Saxon Gold
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Ramses the Great: King of Ancient Egypt
programme.desc: Merenptah, the 13th son of Ramses II, the great pharaoh of Ancient Egypt. Merenptah became pharaoh after his fathers long reign, when all of his older brothers had died. His reign was marked by feuds between rival branches of the family, and the throne was close to bankruptcy

programme.title: Historys Crazy Rich Ancients
programme.desc: Lavish dining is the epitome of living it up, and this programme reveals the rulers, tycoons and visionaries who spent jaw-dropping sums in pursuit of the rarest, the richest, and the most forbidden food and drink money could buy

programme.title: Historys Crazy Rich Ancients
programme.desc: The prized possessions of some of historys richest people havent been castles, jewels, or fine art, but something more exotic - with the ability to bite back. This programme focuses on the monarchs and millionaires who spent their fortunes collecting wild animals

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, William Henry and Jason Martell through the archives of Ancient Aliens to uncover in-depth descriptions and portrayals of entities from Egyptian, Sumerian, Chinese, Mesoamerican and Native American traditions. Ancient Astronaut theorists propose that descriptions of sky gods and star beings might reflect real encounters with extraterrestrial visitors in the remote past

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Theorists investigate whether extraterrestrials might have inspired Adolf Hitler to embark on a crazed quest for global domination, and try to track down the Fuhrers alien secret

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the areas rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarchs reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Headless Romans and Anglo Saxon Gold
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: Andy McGrath explores Devons pre-history in an ancient cavern, takes a crime-through-time tour of Dartmoors prison museum, and uncovers the terrifying legend behind Arthur Conan Doyles The Hound of the Baskervilles

programme.title: Rust Valley Restorers
programme.desc: Forest fires threaten Rust Valley and after his neighbour loses 350 cars, Mike hoards back fuel in case he needs to save his own collection, Cassidy leads the charge on a unique project for charity and James takes on an impossible job

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: The Triumph Herald is a great entry-level classic and car enthusiasts Will and Gus find one with only two previous owners and 50,000 miles on the clock. Its not working and stuck in a barn, but if the duo can address its engine, fuel, braking and gearbox then itll be a gem

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Part one of two. Car builder Ian Roussel starts work on an old unfinished Led Sled project, with the inspirational help from Victor Cacho

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Alabama, Mike goes wild for a rare, barn-fresh Shelby Mustang, while Dani and Robbie visit a New Mexico town

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cowboy hat once owned by none other than actor-turned-president Ronald Reagan arrives on Ricks lap. Meanwhile, an eye-catching Pearl Jam painting causes a stir

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare copy of Seven Years in Tibet signed by author Heinrich Harrer turns up at the shop, and Corey teams up with Chumlee to check out a Three Stooges promotional projector

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The Vegas ladies show up in Bourgie Brea, and find the place fascinating. Mary decides to deal with her storage stress by introducing a bit of yoga into her routine. Ivy and Dave go head to head on a giant pair of sister lockers, though Dave then chooses to sit out the rest of the time

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Victorville, Ivy takes it easy, letting Ivy Jr run the operation. Kenny feels run down and his lack of focus lands him a locker - though theres a pleasant surprise in the end. Mary, Shana and Edwina just cannot seem to make anything stick, so decide to embrace it, doing what they do best.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Cloudy with a Chance of Profit
programme.desc: Its a momentous occasion in Van Nuys for Darrell, and he enjoys a completely groovy time with it. Ivy starts his day off with an unwelcome bang, while Brandi and Jarrod are left wondering whether their unit will bring clear skies or clouds ahead

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Lets Give Em Something to Tonka About
programme.desc: Its a long way to Murietta, and Dave is counting on his competition being unwilling to buy a big locker they need to move. Ivy and Ivy Jr find their day somewhat therapeutic, Mary finally finds a tiny treasure to take home, while Rene stands his ground to protect his honour

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: The actor investigates daring government operations, revealing uncensored evidence and the lengths to which elite operatives have gone to complete missions. Examples include the record-shattering depths submarine divers have plunged to tap a secret Soviet communication line to the Special Ops team of suicidal soldiers sent to hand-deploy A-bombs in enemy territory

programme.title: Historys Most Shocking
programme.sub-title: The Hindenburg Disaster, Pilots Ejection Fail, When Trees Attack and Stuck in a Cave
programme.desc: Analysis of four distinct events - the historic 1937 Hindenburg airship disaster, a pilots successful ejection during a difficult landing, a motorists fight for survival from a falling forest and a cavers struggle to escape a confined space

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Lost Places of the Old Testament
programme.desc: The Old Testaments legendary lost places, such as the Tower of Babel, Sodom and Gomorrah and Mount Sinai, all seemingly vanished from the map

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of six of Britains most famous castles, his journey commencing with a visit to Edinburgh Castle. A popular tourist attraction to this day, Dan explores the history of this famous stronghold that began as an Iron Age battle base and remains a military facility to this day, and was the target of the worlds first aerial bombing

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori try to win valuable lots at auction. Sean uncovers a bin which has been used for a big prank, while Jesse forges controversial allegiances

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Minds are blown when two of the buyers team up for a major score. Jesse takes a big gamble on some African art

programme.title: Canadian Pickers
programme.desc: The guys get an out-of-this-world deal on some Star Wars gear and gatecrash a haughty antiques show. Does high-society mingling guarantee top treasures?

programme.desc: A Wisconsin collectors oversize storage units feature a variety of items including his prized pistol. A former drag racer opens the doors to his museum-quality stockpile of petroliana featuring home-made engine cutaways, a stable full of early Chevrolets and a must-have pick-up

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must each forge judge Ben Abbotts favorite blade, the Celtic ring knife, using the San Mai technique. The final two competitors return to their home forges to re-create Irish ring-hilted swords

programme.title: Bone Detectives: Britains Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and a team of scientists examines remains found at a Roman cemetery which was uncovered on the site of a planned housing estate near Amesbury in Wiltshire. Among the bones recovered is an unusual case of grave disturbance, in which the remains of a middle-aged man seem to have been stabbed and beheaded after burial

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Marge v Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens, and Gays

programme.sub-title: A Ia La Aku (From This Day Forward)
programme.desc: The cops find themselves mingling with the rich and powerful when a guest at a high-society wedding is murdered. programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A seemingly routine surveillance job takes a deadly turn for Catherine and her ex, Billy, leading the team to a hitman. programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge writes a novel and succeeds in getting it published to critical acclaim in the Springfield community. Homer is delighted - until he finds out its plot, which portrays him as an uncaring husband. With the guest voices of authors Tom Clancy and Thomas Pynchon

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In the long-running animations 26th Halloween special, Sideshow Bob finally kills Bart, only to reanimate him. Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss, and Lisa, Bart, and Milhouse get superpowers from radiation

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago

programme.title: Never Mind the Buzzcocks
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy quiz as Clint Boon, Patsy Kensit, Danny Goffey and guest captain Bez join regulars Noel Fielding and Jamali Maddix

programme.title: Romesh: Cant Knock the Hustle
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan explores self-improvement, celebrating his body with a Korean photoshoot and visiting a shaman and experiencing a ritual that leaves him shaken. On Vancouver Island in Canada, he heads to a retreat where he gets up close and personal with fellow men, while in Arizona he meets someone on a mission to live as long as possible. Finally, he tries his hand at being in a Tamil movie to see if beauty and health is a matter of perspective

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: England v Bangladesh. Coverage of the group match from Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati, as Nat Sciver-Brunts side play their second group match. England last won this tournament in 2017 when they beat India in a thrilling final at Lords. Their opponents are playing in just their second World Cup after their first appearance came at the last tournament three years ago

programme.title: ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: England v India. Action from the 2017 final, which took place at Lords, as the teams looked to succeed Australia as champions. These teams faced each other in the opening round of the round-robin fixtures, and on that occasion it was India who came out on top, winning by 35 runs

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Pakistan. Coverage of the group match from R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, as the holders play their third group game of this years tournament. Australia have played in all 12 previous World Cups since the first in 1973, a competition that they finished runners-up in. Pakistan are playing in their sixth World Cup and have never reached the semi-finals before, something theyll be aiming to do this year

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.sub-title: Carling Cup Final 2012-Cardiff City V Liverpool 26.02 Highlights
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.sub-title: Capital One Cup Final 2013-Bradford City V Swansea City 24.02 Highlights
programme.desc: Bradford City v Swansea City. Highlights of the 2013 final at Wembley Stadium, where the League Two Bantams were aiming to produce yet another cup upset. Swansea were appearing in their first major cup final and beat Chelsea in the semi-finals to reach this stage, but Bradford had stolen most of the headlines in the competition this season, belying their lowly league status to eliminate the likes of Arsenal, Aston Villa and Wigan Athletic

programme.title: Live PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Baycurrent Classic. Coverage of the first day of the tournament which takes place at Yokohama Country Club in Japan. This is the first edition of the event after it changed its name from the Zozo Championship, and the seventh overall. Four of the previous six winners have come from the United States with Tiger Woods, Patrick Cantlay, Keegan Bradley and Collin Morikawa all succeeding here since 2019

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Shanghai Masters and the WTA Wuhan Open. Coverage of the events at Qizhong Forest Sports City Arena and Optics Valley International Tennis Center respectively. There was an upset in round four in Shanghai last year when David Goffin overcame second seed Alexander Zverev 6-4, 7-5. British interest ended early in the first round in Wuhan 12 months ago when Katie Boulter was beaten 6-2, 7-5 by Lesia Tsurenko

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: England v Bangladesh. Coverage of the group match from Barsapara Cricket Stadium, Guwahati, as Nat Sciver-Brunts side play their second group match. England last won this tournament in 2017 when they beat India in a thrilling final at Lords. Their opponents are playing in just their second World Cup after their first appearance came at the last tournament three years ago

programme.title: Live World Grand Prix Darts
programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D2 07.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day two from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring first-round matches, played over the best of three sets. Mike De Decker was the shock champion last year and he got his tournament under way 12 months ago with a 2-1 victory over Damon Heta. Later that night, six-time winner of this event Michael van Gerwen was comprehensively beaten 2-0 by Daryl Gurney

programme.title: Live ICC Womens World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Pakistan. Coverage of the group match from R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo, as the holders play their third group game of this years tournament. Australia have played in all 12 previous World Cups since the first in 1973, a competition that they finished runners-up in. Pakistan are playing in their sixth World Cup and have never reached the semi-finals before, something theyll be aiming to do this year

programme.sub-title: World Grand Prix Darts D3 08.10 Leicester Mattioli Arena
programme.desc: Coverage of day three from Mattioli Arena in Leicester, featuring second-round matches, played over the best of five sets. In the closest match of the third day last year, Ryan Joyce claimed a 3-2 win over Nathan Aspinall. There was also a 3-1 victory for Rob Cross against Martin Schindler. Luke Humphries lost years final against Belgiums Mike De Decker 4-6 as the Belgian won his first ever televised title

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britains most talented detectives uncover human trafficking in Bristol, hunt the leader of a county lines gang in Surrey, and trawl through hours of CCTV to stop a vaccine fraudster in London

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Special police task forces tackle violent drug dealers in Gloucestershire, a fraudster in London, and a cruel gang making money illegally trading over two hundred wild birds from a pub

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke and his team are called to a farm in Donnybrook, Western Australia, where a 20-tonne excavator known as The Mud Monster is bogged. The owner was trying to build a recreational dam when the machine got stuck and it has been out of action for months now, burning money and holding up construction. Two other companies have failed to remove it and Team Salvage has just 24 hours and a 5,000 dollar budget to get it done

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke and his team are contracted to remove two stolen vehicles from an abandoned mine site that has been turned into a recreational lake for weekend campers and water skiers. The missing cars are toxic and they have a 15,000-dollar budget and two days to get the job done

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D is in town and is prepared to risk having his fingers burned for the chance of a big score, while auctioneer Sean Kelly keeps a watchful eye

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the hunters are off to Leeds, where a new pair of bidders arrive - and they are not afraid to throw their weight around. Meanwhile, Sam and Ione re-ignite their feud

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders looking for treasures in Ipswich. With Heavy D back in town the bargaining buccaneers are being driven mad by the booming bidder

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Auctioneer Sean Kelly and his bidders head to Broadstairs in Kent where there are some high quality goods up for auction, including a double car lot

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage get busy with a midnight mission - when multiple machines get into trouble, the crew find themselves on the edge of a breakdown.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: The chef concludes his tour with trips to the Languedoc and Provence. In the border town of Uzes, Rick samples salt cod and marvels at a colourful array of French patisserie - selecting a seasonal fig tart to have with his morning coffee. He moves on to the harbour town of Cassis to try North African lamb chorba cooked by a local fisherman, while back in his country kitchen, he prepares a confit tomato and aubergine tarte tatin

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a restaurant-quality meal on the tightest of budgets. They pick up some insider tips from Michelin-starred chef David Everitt-Matthias, are inspired by the work of celebrated 19th-century cook Alexis Soyer, and put everything theyve learnt into practice when they help three girls say thank you to two people who are very important to them

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Ben Miller, Henning Wehn, Doon Mackichan and Alex Brooker to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts this extended episode, with writer and presenter Richard Osman and Observer columnist Sonia Sodha joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, welcoming Jan Ravens, Jimmy Carr and Clive Anderson to the show, along with regular panellist Alan Davies. The host asks questions on the subject of gifts, awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr, in which guests Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Phil Wang, Gabby Logan and Rosie Jones answer questions based on opinion polls

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on the latest events in news and politics, with the help of Maisie Adam, Eshaan Akbar, Ed Byrne, Sophie Duker and Ed Gamble. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedy actors Warwick Davis and Hugh Dennis, comedian Katherine Ryan and journalist John Simpson, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Ben Miller, Henning Wehn, Doon Mackichan and Alex Brooker to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The drama, scheming and backstabbing continue once again as the tribe comes together and decides to exclude a particularly vocal member from participating in camp and strategic talk.

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The end is in sight on the Island of Paradise when Mike makes a risky decision and breaks the Amigos embargo by openly talking tactics with Jacques and Durao in front of everyone.

programme.title: Judge Romesh

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage are tasked with refloating a pre-World War II boat, but on the way to the site, team leader Luke receives an emergency SOS about another mission

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: A massive mega-truck creates a monster problem that could drive the team into the abyss, and Shaun and Sarah call in heavyweight help in a quest to unearth buried treasure

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May find three small cars at an affordable price - a task that involves pestering bankers, harnessing large dogs and almost getting arrested. James meets American rally driver Ken Block, and Jeremy tests out the Mercedes SL Black. Comedian Michael McIntyre is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and James May test the Porsche Panamera against the Royal Mails delivery service, racing a first-class letter to see which travels faster over the full length of the British Isles. Jeremy Clarkson gets chased by the British Army in some of their most deadly toys, and multi Olympic gold medal-winning sprinter Usain Bolt is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Rick Steins Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef retraces a road trip he took in 1968 down the Pacific Coast Highway to the Mexican border and beyond. He begins in San Francisco, the home of sourdough and where Americas love affair with seasonal cooking took hold through restaurants like Chez Panisse, run by Alice Waters, who Rick is keen to meet. The chef also reflects on the time he had his first taste of Mexican food

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Chicken and Egg
programme.sub-title: The Hairy Bikers Chicken and Egg - UK
programme.desc: The duo set out on a new culinary mission, biking across Europe, the Middle East and America to find and cook the most delicious chicken and egg recipes in the world. They start out on home turf, where they demonstrate how to ensure the perfect roast chicken every time, find out how chickens first came to the UK and make cakes and Welsh rarebit at a country show in Wales. As they celebrate the British passion for poultry, other recipes include chicken and leek suet pudding and scotch eggs

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits

programme.desc: Boycie uncovers disturbing information regarding his ancestral line. Tylers surprising return from university adds to his sense of worry, convincing him something serious is about to happen. John Challis and Sue Holderness star

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon are challenged to a cricket match by Warden Hodges, who has signed up a professional for his side. Featuring a guest appearance by former England and Yorkshire fast bowler Fred Trueman. Vintage comedy first shown in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and Bill Pertwee

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slades resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Here We Go into the Wild Blue Yonder
programme.desc: Part one of two. Compo yearns to reach for the skies in a hang-glider to impress Nora Batty, but finds a challenge to climb a tree more than enough to handle. Meanwhile, the object of his affections pesters Wally to take her out for a meal. Long-running comedy set in rural Yorkshire, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Here We Go Again into the Wild Blue Yonder

programme.desc: The Eastgate branch of the bank finds itself in urgent need of a new manager - and who should step into the breach but Sergeant Wilson. His new life does not last long, however, as his place of work is bombed the day he arrives. Comedy first shown in 1970, starring John Le Mesurier

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The girls celebrate Japanese-style at their work party, and Bren enters right into the spirit of things - but not as much as her mother, who turns up unexpectedly. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Julie Walters and Jack Smethurst

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Morale plummets to its lowest point in the canteen with Tony in hospital and Dolly and Jean staging a walk-out, leaving Bren to run the graveyard shift single-handedly on the most important night of the year. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Andrew Dunn, Shobna Gulati and Celia Imrie

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: The wedding is put at risk after Denise kicks up a stink and accuses Dave of a heinous crime - flirting with Beverley Macca. As far as shes concerned, the wedding is off. After a talk with parents Jim and Barbara, Denise softens her stance and the family seeks an appropriate way to celebrate the pairs reconciliation. Comedy written by and starring Caroline Aherne and Craig Cash, with Ricky Tomlinson and Sue Johnston

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Denise is a bag of nerves as her wedding day finally arrives, while Jim is practising his speech and Antony is being teased about his new haircut. Alone in the house after the others have left for the church, Jim is uncharacteristically tender in soothing Denises nerves

Their three daughters are fed up with the clutter, embarrassed to bring friends over. Nick offers to clear half their belongings in return for a total home makeover

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Emillie and Bill found a backyard farm right near the city, but the homes impractical layout was keeping them from focusing on their beautiful outdoor space

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Dan and Brianne purchased a ranch-style home in Pasadena seven years ago, and its the only one their two young children have ever known

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and the team head to the Worcestershire village of Eckington to help 17-year-old Antonia Payne-Cheney, who has Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, a rare and debilitating condition that causes her joints to regularly dislocate and means she cannot eat normally and is fed through a tube. The ambitious build features a functional, sterile space for medical procedures in her bedroom, a specially adapted wet room and an accessible area where she can socialise with friends and family

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The contestants get one more shot at immunity in an Alphabet Lucky Dip Challenge

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Emergency workers rush to the aid of a man who is struggling to breathe after injecting himself

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: First-time parents Rochalla and her unflappable partner Craig arrive 10 days overdue. Her shock pregnancy defied medical odds as she conceived just weeks after an aggressive course of chemotherapy. Cameras also follow train driver Kieron and his wife Joanne, who find it hard to kick their clockwatching habit during labour. While self-confessed ladies man Michael and partner Natalia prepare for the arrival of her fourth child

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Womens Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier whos more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although theyre apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Its the famous Varsity Week, when rival Oxbridge universities hit town for a downhill grudge match - alongside the usual dramatic backdrop of cases from the slopes of Val Thorens

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Patrol teams work to prevent avalanches, using dynamite, train their rescue dogs, and desperately seek a 14-year-old boy who is missing after skiing off-piste alone

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete to get their big break in the world of commercial interior design. For their first challenge, head judge Michelle Ogundehin asks them to transform five upmarket rental apartments in Manchester. Working in pairs, the designers must take on a living room or master bedroom, and then work together on a shared home office

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Anna and Stuart rush to the home of a former soldier who has fallen down some stairs and has a potential spinal injury. Ben and Laura attend a young boy with suspected appendicitis

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The team are in the Cotswolds to save single mum Sally from her chaotic and clutter-filled home. Sally lives with 19-year-old daughter Hannah and 18-year-old son Josh, and works full time from home as a childminder. Her jam-packed house doubles up as a workspace, and sadly for her kids, work has taken over, and it no longer feels like home. Nick hopes to create an effective work environment, a sanctuary for Sally and a space for the kids

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: John and Lynn love the ample space and beautiful backyard of their home - they watched their two daughters grow up there and cant imagine living anywhere else

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Jennifer, Paul and their son Brendan live in the perfect neighbourhood, but their outdated and rundown house is anything but perfect

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: When Terry Guest had a brain injury, he was left with severe disabilities, and the only care available for him was an old peoples dementia care home, where he remained for several years. His sister Tracey offered help, but like Terrys home, her house was also unsuitable. Nick Knowless regulars and a team of South Yorkshire volunteers and suppliers step in to adapt Traceys home and build Terry his own separate pad at the end of the garden

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Its a race against time as the contestants have 90 minutes to use across two rounds and come up with two courses

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson presents a pared-down approach to cuisine in which she reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. She prepares avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and chicksalad and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows Kirstine and Phil, who have not spent a day apart in four years, but following an emergency during labour the pair find themselves separated. Cameras also focus on independent businesswoman Tyla. While awaiting the arrival of her third child, she starts to reconsider her romantic future. And although Spanish nurses Carlota and Javier epitomise the perfect relationship, the pair realise that labour can be challenging even for the best of partnerships

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Career woman Charlene, 35, is struggling to comes to terms with the fact she is about to become a mum, after dedicating her life to climbing the career ladder. Her mother Marion and Aunt Bev use Liverpudlian humour to help her through the final stages of labour. Cameras also follow Jess, 21, who fell pregnant after a fling and only truly believed the news when she saw her first scan. Plus, Sam, 41, who swore she would never have another child after the traumatic birth of her first, is convinced her late mother is in the labour room with her

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: An intimate look at life for women in the Western Massachusetts Regional Womens Correctional Centre. Cameras follow notorious gang member Baby D, who considers herself to be the prisons most powerful inmate, and has her sights set on a woman in a rival gang for her next attack. Pregnant Vanessa arrives, and after losing custody of her other children, she is desperate to secure a place on a drug rehabilitation programme. Will she get out of prison before the birth?

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: Transgender inmate Franklin falls in love with a fellow prisoner, but they must keep their relationship a secret or face being placed in solitary confinement. A fight breaks out over a carton of milk, and a pregnant prisoner trying to recover from heroin addiction faces losing a place on a treatment programme - which could result in her baby being born in prison and taken from her

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants are sent to Wotton House, a grand hotel in the Surrey Hills, where they must each transform one of the nine bedrooms to create a space that reflects their signature style but with an eccentric British twist. The designers relish the challenge, embracing the idea of British eccentricity, although some take a more liberal approach, leading to surprising results. Alan Carr follows their progress, while helping Michelle Ogundehin survey the spaces is guest judge Guy Oliver, who has designed the interiors for some of the best-known hotels in London

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: V and Ollie blue light to a rugby pitch to help a man who had a seizure. Plus, Stef and Lee treat an excitable 6-year-old Spider-Man fighting an asthma attack

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his great American trek, following his copy of Appletons General Guide east from Manhattan to Long Island, and visits Brooklyn to hear the story of the construction of the worlds first suspension bridge. Below ground, he investigates New York Citys inaugural subway, and the dangers faced by the sandhogs who built it. Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of Americas richest men. Later, he heads to the islands Gold Coast, where he relives the fun of the roaring twenties at Oheka Castle, and concludes this leg of his trip at the Montauk lighthouse on Long Islands eastern-most tip

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows Americas iconic River Hudson, beginning at New York Citys Penn Station, where he rides on the national rail carrier service, Amtrak. At Tarrytown, he hears a famous American ghost story, the Legend of Sleepy Hollow, and on the east bank of the Hudson he stops at Garrison, where he hears about the greatest turncoat in American history. In Poughkeepsie, the presenter visits a university built just for women, before arriving in New Yorks state capital, Albany, where he samples Albany Ale and meets the State Senator

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in Lincolnshire picking up a 1935 Riley Falcon - a good-looking saloon car, with a pre-select gearbox

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek brings a small army of military hardware to Thornton le Dale including a Studebaker Weasel tracked vehicle and a WWII-era Willys Jeep

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hanbury Hall in Droitwich. Among the rarities brought in to be valued are a jacket designed by Peter Blake, which proves less valuable for being nibbled by a ferret, a nude painting and a sketch of Napoleon on his deathbed. Andy McConnell examines the oldest piece of glass he has seen in his career, and Fiona is challenged to spot a 2500-year-old Greek vessel among three fakes

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where the experts value a selection of rare finds from the regions historic potteries, as well as a brooch that belonged to flying ace Amy Johnson and a portable road map. Plus, Fiona is challenged to spot the cheap imitation in a collection of gold necklaces

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek auctions off a Jensen Interceptor and a Jensen Healey along with a one-off Wood and Pickett Triumph Dolomite Sprint. Sarah takes a shine to a four-tonne road roller

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1971 Mercedes SL and a 1989 Jaguar XJS emerge from a barn on a chicken farm, a Roller and a Rover go under the hammer and a 1966 Triumph Spitfire is restored to near perfection

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the conclusion of his two-part journey, Simon investigates the environmental challenges facing Cornwall and the rest of the country. He discovers how the regions farmers are adopting new, less intensive approaches that are both more profitable and environmentally friendly, and reveals how reintroducing beavers to the uplands could tackle the problem of widespread flooding. He also encounters some of the countys iconic wildlife, including grey seals that live in constant risk of getting caught up in discarded fishing nets

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus buy a Porsche 923 with a cracked interior, bad paintwork and ripped seats. This driving legend is well past its best, but they still hope to turn a profit

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Jacks off to East Yorkshire for an iconic 1980s motor, where a Ford enthusiast is thinning out his herd of nine Escorts

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring the Tunnels of Gibraltar, a Second World War espionage base, hidden in the Rock of Gibraltar

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels across New York state, discovering how General Electric also leads the way in rail technology and examining the story behind George Eastmans Kodak company. He then visits Buffalo and discovers the history behind its grain industry, followed by a trip to witness the awesome power and drama of Niagara Falls

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Philadelphia, and pays tribute to its fictional son, Rocky Balboa. He finishes the latest leg of his journey in Gettysburg, the most famous battlefield of the American Civil War, where President Abraham Lincoln made a momentous speech in 1863

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul collects a cherished 1924 Rover 9 thats been in the same family since the 1950s and only had one previous owner before that

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads north to pick up a 1954 Morgan +4 coupe in mint condition and believed to be just one of three still on the road

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where items featured include an early camera which had previously been used for natural history photography, a dagger with a gruesome history, a shawl that once belonged to a movie star, and a small 18th-century figurine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Lyme Park in Cheshire, famously the location for the 1995 TV adaptation of Pride and Prejudice. Items brought in to be valued include a pair of pistols used to protect royal mail coaches from highwaymen, a tea caddy disguised as a pile of books, and a portrait of actress Sarah Bernhardt that once belonged to Elton John

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek takes a shine to a rare 1958 Armstrong Siddeley Sapphire with a long family history and a convertible Triumph Herald brings a few smiles on auction day

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son Barney embark on the final leg of their journey, which sees the pair arrive in the Louisiana city of New Orleans. Here, they visit a spiritual voodoo priest for a spot of energy cleansing, and feed alligators in the Bayou with Captain Billy, who knows every corner of the wetlands, having been born and raised on the bayous of South Louisiana. Later, Bradley hops on board the Natchez jazz Steamboat, before the pair take to the streets to lead a spectacular parade with a six-piece band

programme.title: Irelands Unidentified Bodies
programme.desc: A look at the six-year investigation that followed a body being discovered in Rusheen Woods, Co Galway in 2014. Plus, revisiting a 1986 case in Leitrim with the help of DNA evidence that was not available at the time, and how advances in technology also helped to identify a body found near Bunrattu in 2001 17 years later

programme.title: The Body in the Bin: Who Killed Louise Kam?
programme.desc: What began as an audacious plot to defraud £5million from unsuspecting 71-year-old mother and businesswoman Louise Kam ended in her murder, after which her body was callously dumped in a wheelie bin on a driveway belonging to one of the killers. This documentary follows this shocking story of fraud, murder and the impact of social media

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is suspected of being a hit-and-run driver, while Vernon is hired to escort two singers to a gig - but soon discovers he has an aversion to loud music and offloads the responsibility onto David, who is no match for the conniving pair

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: In Monmouthshire in South Wales, Simon Parfett and his team take on a 1980s double decker bus conversion for recycling centre worker Stacy

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The discovery of a local landowners body throws suspicion on two of his tenants, a couple who have previously been threatened with violence for refusing to move out of their cottage. Rather than stay and face the music they disappear, and Wycliffe realises if he does not get to them before the victims family, the consequences could be deadly. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Jimmy Yuill

programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.sub-title: Britains Biggest Ever... Drugs Bust/Cash Robbery
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder examines real-life cases, looking at the events leading up to crimes, going through the police investigations and summing up the trials

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A local man confesses to a girls murder of 11 years previously, prompting Sgt Miller to reopen the case. Rural drama, guest starring Graham Turner and Geoffrey Hutchings, with John Duttine, Steven Blakeley and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: The Royal

Meanwhile, PC Ventress brings two men found fighting over a girl to the Royal, where one promptly collapses due to a brain haemorrhage. Weatherill faces a testing time when she helps deliver a baby and nurse Meryl reveals she may be pregnant. Medical drama series, starring Robert Daws, Michelle Hardwick and Julian Ovenden

programme.title: Murder in Provence
programme.desc: A love affair seems to be at the heart of a womans death in the town of Eguilles, but Antoine, Marine and Helene think it might be connected to the discovery of an older womans body at a vineyard kilometres away. They investigate the men in the two womens lives to discover what was done to them and why. Starring Roger Allam and Nancy Carroll

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A group of young offenders come to stay at Ashfordly Hall, but soon find themselves under suspicion after a spate of disturbances in the village. Rural drama, starring Rupert Vansittart, William Simons, Derek Fowlds and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sarah receives a letter confirming the date of a scan, while Chas tries to make Charity see sense. Nicola, Jimmy and the kids move in with an aghast Laurel

programme.desc: Primary school teacher Tara can only build temporary structures on a piece of Wiltshire land she inherited. Using a reassembled corrugated metal shed, Simon devises a plan to create a tiny off-grid eco shed that will be a unique place to stay

programme.desc: When an unpopular pub landlord is beaten to death, a police informant casts suspicion on his ex-wife and her new husband. Drama, starring John Thaw

programme.title: Judge Rinders Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder recalls arguably the most audacious robbery in British criminal history, when in November 2000 an armed gang tried to steal the priceless Millennium Star diamond on display at the Millennium Dome, south-east London. Plus, the case of gamekeeper Billy Stirrat, whose life was turned upside down following a miscarriage of justice involving his wrongful arrest for the possession of £500,000 worth of amphetamine

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Ruth Watson advises Keith and Val Morris on ways to revamp their failing hotel and conference centre the Hanmer Arms, which is losing money despite being large and well-equipped. She explains why the lack of a full-time receptionist and permanent head chef mean problems with continuity - and urges the reluctant and negative owners to boost their dwindling bookings by attracting corporate clients

programme.title: Wild Britain

Starring Michael Starke, Amy Robbins and Robert Daws, and featuring a guest appearance by Tricia Penrose in her Heartbeat guise of Gina Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate a hit-and-run incident in Ashfordly and discover evidence suggesting it may have been an act of revenge - with the victims own mother-in-law one of the possible suspects. Meanwhile, Peggy finds herself in trouble again when her latest batch of illegal cigarettes turn out to contain an unexpected ingredient

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Alison Brooks, a 29-year-old deaf woman, works in the canteen of Kent and Canterbury police station, where her lip-reading skills thrust her into a high-stakes police investigation. Recruited by DI James Marsh and DS Ashleigh Francis, Alison proves invaluable as she assists in surveilling a gang planning a major heist, while she also has to navigate her mothers financial struggles, a broken relationship, and the ableist attitudes she encounters at work. Crime drama, starring Rose Ayling-Ellis, Andrew Buchan and Charlotte Ritchie
